intro: Fimbristylis ciliolata, commonly known as the hairy fringed sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist to waterlogged soils. Its slender, grass-like stems are often adorned with fine, hairy structures along the edges, giving it its common name. Fimbristylis ciliolata produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family.
